column1: ReqID,text
abcd123,"Data Science / Machine Learning Engineer - Responsible for successful delivery of data science solutions and services in a client consulting environment. In this role, you will:
* Lead strategy discussions and help to design and develop a solution that meets clients goals and outcomes
* Define key business problems to be solved and formulate mathematical approaches and gather data to solve those problems, develop, analyze/draw conclusions, test solutions and present to client.

* Leverage your experiences in predictive modeling, optimization, and/or machine learning analytics techniques using tools/programming languages including Python, R, Spark, etc. as well as ML Deployment capabilities like Docker, Container, Microservices, Kubernetees within a Big data-enabled environment

* Demonstrate End to End understanding of a Model Development Lifecycle and frameworks with a focus on implementation libraries/packages/APIs (e.g. scikit-learn, Theano, Spark MLlib, H2O, TensorFlow etc.)
* Enhance performance by applying advanced mathematical modeling, data analytics, optimization, and machine learning techniques

* Implement new, highly scalable platform components and tools leveraging machine learning and deep learning models to solve real-world problems in areas such as speech recognition, natural language processing and time series predictions
* Deploy packaged solutions using tools/frameworks such as React JS, Flask, Maven etc.
* Conduct real world statistical A/B testing scenarios and fine tune models based on feedback Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

* Prior consulting &/or relevant work experience in one of the following industries: Communications – (Media & Entertainment, Telecom, Utilities), Distribution – (Customer Package Goods, Pharmaceutical, Retail, Travel & Transportation), Financial Services – (Banking, Financial Markets, Insurance), Industrial – (Aerospace & Defense, Automotive, Chemicals & Petroleum / Industrial Products, Electronics), Public – (Healthcare & Life Sciences, Government)

* Possess required skills and education associated with Predictive or Business Analytics; Business or Marketing Intelligence; Computer Science; Computer Information Sciences and Technology; Computer or Management Information Systems; Information Technology; Applied Mathematics; Applied Statistics; and Operations Research
* Strong Computer Science background
* Familiarity with Clouds such as Azure, AWS, IBM Cloud and Google Cloud
* Issue-based consulting skills"
cash123,"Cashier Job Description

A Cashier's primary role is to assist customers in the in-store check-out process. Main duties include ringing up sales, bagging items, requesting price checks, honoring coupons, collecting payment and giving appropriate change. Responsible for counting the contents of cash register drawer at the end of each shift, maintaining receipts, records and withdrawals. May be responsible for checking materials and supplies and reporting when stock is low.

May require a high school diploma or its equivalent and 0-2 years of experience in the field or in a related area. Has knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices and procedures within a particular field. Works under immediate supervision of supervisor or manager and must rely on instructions. Primary job functions do not typically require exercising independent judgment. Abides by pre-established guidelines to perform the functions of the job. The successful candidate will play a fundamental role in achieving our customer satisfaction and revenue growth objectives.
Responsibilities:

column3: Handle cash, credit or check transactions with customers
Issue change, receipts, refunds, or tickets
Count money in cash drawers at the beginning and end of shifts to ensure that amounts are correct and that there is adequate change
Make sales referrals, cross-sell products and introduce new ones
Resolve customer complaints, guide them and provide relevant information
Greet customers when entering or leaving establishment
Maintain clean and tidy checkout areas
Process returns and check to see if items are damaged
Answer customers' questions and get a manager if answer doesn't solve the issue
Pleasantly deal with customers to ensure satisfaction

wmp1234,"West Monroe isn’t a start-up consulting firm, but we act like one.

From day one, our people have the opportunity to make a definitive personal impact for their clients and their careers. What does this mean? It means we seek out the best of the best, and then we challenge them to make us better.

We serve an array of interesting and exciting clients across four key service areas: Customer Experience, Mergers & Acquisitions, Operations Excellence, and Technology – Business Analytics. You will provide expertise, lead technical implementation initiatives or deliver operation improvement across industries such as Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, and Healthcare & Life Sciences.

We celebrate driven professionals who thrive in a collaborative environment. Our consultants work on front lines – partnering with clients to deliver game changing solutions in the most dynamic industries. Sound interesting? Then West Monroe Partners just might be the place for you.
Think you’re up to the challenge?

West Monroe Partners is currently in search of high-performance graduate interns this summer, pursuing their MBA, or other Master’s, to join our TREK (Training, Readiness, Exposure, Knowledge) Program. TREK offers motivated students with the opportunity to work directly with clients, develop project deliverables, collaborate closely with project teams, network and build relationship within our organization, and participate in all programs and events available to our employees, in addition to developing core consulting skills that will prepare them for a career in consulting.

Graduate interns may be considered for a full-time opportunity with West Monroe Partners at the conclusion of the internship. The level at the firm will be based on pre-MBA/graduate school experience as well as performance during the internship.

Please read below for a description of each practice area seeking graduate interns this summer. You will have the opportunity to indicate which practice area aligns with your career interests during the online application process. Opportunities are available in various office locations, including Chicago, Minneapolis, New York City, and Seattle. Technology Business Analytics TREK Intern

West Monroe Partners is currently seeking a Graduate Intern with a strong desire to pursue a career in consulting in its Business Analytics Practice. This is an excellent opportunity to work within our Information Management team with Fortune 250 clients developing BI strategy and roadmaps, implementing new customer facing reporting and analytics platforms, while gaining exposure to a variety of industries including healthcare, insurance, manufacturing, E&U, and professional services. Candidates should demonstrate in-depth understanding and prior experience in Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services, ETL development, and reporting solutions.
Responsibilities:
· Client Delivery:
o Work directly with clients to implement processes and technology that support business value and process efficiency across business and technical functions

o Work closely with the line of business stakeholders to map existing or develop new business processes o Participate in client workshops focused designing future state business process and requirements by
working with the team to prepare for and facilitate
o Support business and technical requirements gathering and process mapping
o Work closely with the team on program evaluations against industry leading practices across industries
· Program Management:
o Participate in the creation of project-related deliverables such as project plans, implementation plans,
communication plans, and status reports
o Work closely with engagement team to reduce project risk
o Work closely with members of WMP as well as our clients to establish rapport
· Business and Practice Development:
o Participate in the business development process by assisting in the development of project approaches
Qualifications
and proposals
o Participate in the practice development process by assisting in the development of tools, methodologies, templates, and techniques used by WMP on client assignments
· Bachelor’s degree in related discipline; MBA or other Master’s degree in process
· 2 to 6 years of experience working in a collaborative team-based, professional environment
· Experience working directly with external clients/internal stakeholders

· Experience in developing work plans, project scopes, and business analysis · Strong project management and organizational skills, detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment
· Demonstrate excellent judgment and decision-making; develop a sense of urgency, respond or escalate, as appropriate
· Demonstrate interest and understanding of the preferred practice area
· Prior experience in consulting is preferred, but not required
· Experience with implementations, business requirements gathering, vendor evaluation, or scoping a technology or software platform is helpful
· Strong presentation skills; experience with creating or delivering presentations
· Strong interpersonal, written and oral communications, and client relations skills
· Ability to work permanently in the United States without sponsorship
· Ability to travel up to 80% is required
· Ability to relocate to the city where the opportunity is based for the duration of the internship"
jpm1234,"JPMorgan 2014 Summer Finance Analyst Development Program
LOB: Asset Management
Role Function: Business Management
Team Name: Midwest Private Bank

Team Description: The JP Morgan Private Bank provides integrated wealth management services for ultra-high-net-worth and high-net-worth families and individuals worldwide, and advises clients on over $600B of client balances in the US alone, across investment management, trust, capital market, credit and deposit products. The Midwest Private Bank Finance team is responsible for analytics, financial reporting and business management of the Private Bank markets in the Midwest (IL, MO, MN, IN, MI & WI).  The team works closely with the Midwest management team as well as various contacts in Regional and Product finance and Planning & Analysis.
Role Description:

column2: Support Region CFO and market Business Finance Managers with special projects and market initiatives
Maintain and improve weekly financial and headcount reporting process
Coordinate data consolidation, creation and analysis of front-office metrics
Identify opportunities for improvement in existing processes and reports; convey the findings in a simple, compelling way
Develop ad hoc analyses of business drivers to support decision making by Midwest leadership team
Actively participate in weekly team and other ad hoc meetings

column1: Projects:

column2: Weekly reporting (flow chart of flows)
Tech spend
Trust fee schedule (apply new rates)
11th Floor ($aving$)
Investor Scorecard (couldn’t take example with, allocate each client’s revenue change, assets, etc)
WAR edits (weekly activity report’s best practives)
Rush sponsorship (compare BOD to all clients and prospects)
Events data (correlate client details from events with revenue or asset change)
Activity of bankers (calls, meetings)

column1: Technical Skills:

column2: Vlookups
Shortcuts
Data validation
Pivots
Access queries
Ad hoc data pulls

column1: FADP

column2: Ideal place for an analyst interested in the many different career paths that finance has to offer
Designed to develop finance professionals ho share our passion for instituting meaningful change and delivering powerful financial results for JPMorgan Chase.
The summer program is our primary hiring pipeline for our full time FADP

Providing end to end financial management, you will be exposed to diverse project assignments that offer a hands on learning experience and the opportunity to make real contributions to business decisions
Working closely with experienced senior managers, you will analyze results and offer insights across performance, strategy, control issues, and operation models
Accounting, Reporting & Control; Planning and Analysis; Business Management; Treasury"

column1: pgi5678,"Junior Analyst - Fixed Income Consumer & Industrial Team - #216509
Responsibilities:

Provide research and analysis in the fixed income investing function. Proactively research, compile, and analyze information to aid the investment staff in making informed investment decisions. Provide suggestions, comments, and recommendations on investments. Assist with bond pricing, tracking covenants, report generation/review, and special projects.
Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree in business or related field, preferably with a major in finance, economics or accounting, and 1-2 years related experience, or equivalent (Co-op or progressive internships of 1 or more years), are required.
High (3.5 or higher) undergraduate GPA is preferred.
Progress toward CFA or MBA preferred.
Regardless of undergraduate major, a general understanding of basic accounting and finance principles and financial statements is essential.
Must have and maintain a general knowledge of investments and a detailed understanding of bond mechanics and pricing calculations.

Required is a strong ability to efficiently and effectively research and compile information, insuring all work is complete while including only that information which is most germane to the task at hand.
Must have basic computer proficiency, including Word and Internet research skills, and advanced Excel ability.
Analytical skills must be well developed and proven through experience.
Interpersonal skills required include the ability to work independently, take initiative, be detail-oriented, and effectively prioritize simultaneous, multiple tasks.
Must have excellent written and oral communication skills to be able to effectively and professionally communicate with internal and external contacts.
External contacts include, but are not limited to, attorneys, brokers, and clients.
This position may be subject to SEC restrictions on personal political contributions."
eqty373,"Responsibilities:

Edge Asset Management manages more than $29 billion in fixed income, equity and asset allocation mutual funds and is committed to a legacy of straightforward investment solutions. Formerly WM Advisors, Edge was acquired by Principal Global Investors in January 2007 and is a separate subsidiary based in Seattle, WA.

Edge is seeking top talent to add to their team of investment professionals as an Equity Analyst. As part of our equity team, you would assist in the management of multiple portfolios consistent with the firm's investment philosophy and process. In addition, you would be responsible for the following:
- Make long-term investment recommendations for multiple portfolios.
- Monitoring existing investments within your industry coverage.

- Work with portfolio team members by making buy, sell or hold recommendations on existing investments. - Contribute your insights to the entire investment team, which includes fixed income and asset allocation.
Qualifications:
Successful candidates will have:
- MBA with finance emphasis or Chartered Financial Analyst designation required, both are preferred.
- 2-4 year’s investment experience or relevant business experience. Preference for individuals with 4-7 year's of investment experience.
- Deep knowledge of equity analysis across multiple sectors.
- Must be a self-starter and demonstrate understanding of economies and investment theories. - Must have strong written and verbal communication skills.
- This position may be subject to SEC restrictions on personal political contributions."

acrm789,"The Associate Consultant Relationship Manager will collaborate with the Senior Consultant Relations team to proactively support platform relationships to advance relationships and opportunities across all investment strategies in the consultant channel (Equities, Fixed Income, Real Estate, and Multi-Asset). The role will prepare Senior Consultants for meetings with intel on targeted firm's current initiatives, recent activity and due diligence on key contacts, and provide required follow up materials after meetings, and field inquiries.
Additional responsibilities may include:

• Play key role in new business efforts including finals presentations and consultant meetings by providing updates on investment marketing activities, and how portfolio management, research and other functions are presented externally. Collaborate internally to help establish and implement the investment business plans and strategies.

• Assist Senior Consultants in delivering best-in-class coverage of key constituents at client firms by providing proactive materials that includes competitor intelligence, investors trends, due diligence on key contacts in meetings; all recent searches, interactions, and ratings specific to the target firm.

• Assist with various PGI wide projects to establish systems, processes, structures and procedures to ensure the efficient and profitable delivery of superior client service and marketing to PGI customers and prospects. Provide timely, complete responses to ad hoc requests for information and research and manage multiple projects given strict deadlines.

• Ensure periodic distribution of deliverables to clients, and assist in presentation preparation. Maintain CRM data of target firms including: key personnel changes at target firms, changes in ratings, recent search activity, types of clients, relative investment strategies and investment vehicles in use.

• Leverage coordination of PGI resources including internal and external sales teams, operations marketing and investment services to ensure customization of marketing books, webinars and other related materials. In partnership with the Boutiques, provide PGI product, client and industry expertise in order to participate in the development of quality RFI's, RFP's and consultant and
industry information requests. Collaborate with sales team and product owners to respond to product proposals, prospective client requests, finals presentations and client meetings.
Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree or equivalent, plus 3 - 4 years directly related experience in Consultant Relations or related market place.
• Active FINRA Series 7. If you do not have active licensing, Series 7 must be obtained within 6 months from date of employment.
• Must have strong decision-making skills and use good judgment.
• Excellent organizational, problem-solving, presentation, and oral and written communication skills
required.
• Must be able to multi-task and thrive in a growing channel of a diversified investment management
organization.
• Some travel may be required."
